"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b880e963687235a8860500#post_53b880e963687235a8860500
You're forgetting that Isis is a muslamic terrorist organisation. In most countries terrorism isn't exactly held in the _highest_ regard. It won't be the start of World War III but there will probably be a lot of fighting.
Religious extremism (on ALL counts, not just islam) is _literally_ the cancer of the planet. All it does is generate hate, death and stupidity.

You're forgetting that Isis is a muslamic terrorist organisation. In most countries terrorism isn't exactly held in the _highest_ regard. It won't be the start of World War III but there will probably be a lot of fighting.
Religious extremism (on ALL counts, not just islam) is _literally_ the cancer of the planet. All it does is generate hate, death and stupidity.[/bq]
Yeah; I know.  That's why I didn't say it would be a traditional world war, rather a ton of countries getting dragged into this.  What I mean by this is that if the fighting spills over into Turkey(the fighting is getting pretty damn close to Turkey) we're all going to get dragged into this regional war and we wouldn't even be able to ignore it cause ISIS is thinking about declaring holy war so yeah shit's hitting the fan in the middle east.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b887d5636872647fd00100#post_53b887d5636872647fd00100
It gets worse in that we wouldn't be able to bail out like we did in Iraq.  We would *HAVE* to stay until the fighting stopped and let's face it it's the middle east, when are they ever going to stop fighting?

If it does happen we're talking a 20+ years war.

The way it's probably going to go down is that the fighting will start spilling over into Turkey and potentially other countries; at first it'll be a war to contain ISIS' expansion, but as time goes on they're going to get more and more powerful until we have to go in there and then say hello to decades upon decades of war.

The entire middle east has been a powder keg waiting to go off and it's now been lit. . . No; we can't ignore it either anymore than ignoring a stick of tnt in your pants makes it any less of a explosion.
"@Ore-O":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b88883636872647f150200#post_53b88883636872647f150200
[bq="Ore-O"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b8879163687263c0660100#post_53b8879163687263c0660100
While Ebola is happening.[/bq]
Honestly; that's probably the only thing at this point that can prevent the shit from hitting the fan.
